Posts.Content: Hi lulupop, Sorry to hear you have further diagnosis but at least they've got it now. I too had/have lobular grade 2. I wasn't offered mastectomy they just did lumpectomy and now I'm in middle of chemo. I'm continually worrying that they didn't find it all even though like you and others I have been told both CT and MRI are clear. I read on internet that lobular can be hard to spot especially on mammogram. It grows in sheet-like fashion. Maybe it is hard to spot on MRI too. Just hope the chemo is doing its thing, that's all I'm hanging on to. In your case did they recommend mastectomy even though your tumour was small? I didn't get a choice just told we are doing a lumpectomy and you don't need a mastectomy.
Posts.Title: after mastectomy found more cancer in breast tissue

Posts.Content: Miss Wolfie and NiceCuppa, I would agree it's the bone marrow injection causing the back pain. Usually I get the bone pain starting about 24 hrs after the Neulasta injection. But on one occasion my first EC cycle the pain arrived on Day 10 and was totally debilitating. I was lucky enough to be in hospital with neutropenia at the time and they were able to give me IV pain relief. Apart from being in labour I haven't experienced pain like it ever before. In my experience the pain is worse if it's delayed, if it starts early then it's doable. Hope you two can find ways to cope with it. I found lying flat on my back gave me some relief. Maybe docs would give you Naproxen or something strong to cope with it.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks NiceCuppa, Did they put you on antibiotics? I have been given antibiotics even though my bloods are good and there is no sign of an infection. I'm only to start taking them if temperature goes up again.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Good luck to all either continuing on chemo or moving on to surgery/radio! I'm half way through chemo just finished 3 EC and now will have 3 docetaxel, first cycle of it is due on 14th March. Can't really put into words how much this forum helps me.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for docetaxel advice. Currently getting my infusion and thankfully no allergy side effects have developed. Hope that continues since read somewhe that these can happen a few hours after the chemo.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all, I've been on antibiotics with this 1st docetaxel cycle because I have high temperatures. My temperatures started on day 3. Day 4 I was assessed and white bloods were good so discharged. Temperatures continued and I was assessed again on day 7, bloods good again but was started on antibiotics on day8 just in case it was an infection . By day 10 fevers had continued. I was on maximum paracetamol intake to keep the temperatures down. On day10 went and got assessed again and this time they admitted me to hospital because inflammatory markers elevated and was put on IV antibiotics. This is day 14 now and I'm still in hospital and still getting fevers but they are becoming less frequent and are talking about letting me out tomorrow. Oncologist is going to switch me to paclitaxel since he thinks docetaxel is disagreeing with me. Strange thing is that apart from the fevers I seemed to not be getting the other typical docetaxel side effects. What can I say I'm a weird case!!
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: NiceCuppa and Horsing Around, I also found the nausea pretty bad when on EC. All I can say is it gradually settles just take each day one at a time and dont expect too much of yourselves. Try to eat small and often because I found it actually got worse when I didn't eat. I survived on small amounts of porridge and sucking Pineapple Polly ice lollies for a few days. Then when I started to come out of it, in my case about Day 7 or 8, I really felt quite good. I have finished EC now and start on docetaxel tomorrow. I have been reading the 'chemo' tips page and reading back through the chemo forums to try and pick up tips for dealing with the various docetaxel side effects.  Anyone got any more advice for me I'm really nervous and actually starting to feel nauseous already. They have given me dexamethasone 2mg tablets. I have to take 8 of these today, tomorrow and the day after. Is this normal? Do they give you more antisickness tablets to deal with nausea if you get it? Normally when on EC they gave me emend to take tomorrow but they didn't this time. Any advice gratefully received. Thanks everyone
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all,  Just to recommend to you all to contact your local Macmillan to see if they run '''Look Good Feel Better" events. I attended one in my area yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed it   As well as meeting others going through BC treatment they give you tips on applying make-up and a goodie bag to take home. It was good fun and a really good laugh. I realized I haven't been laughing enough lately.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all,  Have any of you developed a fever on docetaxel. This is my first cycle of it which I got last Thursday. Then on Sunday got a bit of a temperature which I ignored. I know -- bad idea. Then on Monday temperature got higher so ended up at hospital assessment unit. They took bloods and started me on antibiotics. My blood results were good so they said I didn't need antibiotics and sent me home. However temperature is still misbehaving, it went up to 39 this morning and then down to 37.8 when I drank a couple of pints of water. So they've taken more bloods today and now waiting on results of those. At first they were blaming the Neulasta injection because I don't have an infection but now I'm wondering if it's just my response to the docetaxel. Thank goodness theyve allowed me to take paracetamol and ibuprofen so feeling a bit better. My poor body is just giving up.
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Tray46, Hope you get an anti-sickness tablet that works for you very soon. The sore scalp could be the start of your hair coming out. I found I had a very tender scalp for a few weeks before my hair fell out.

Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Oh meant to say NiceCuppa I also have a foghorn beside me! Just glad he's sleeping at the moment though because he looks like someone on chemo because of lack of sleep and the worry of me! He's also bald!
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all,  I've been switched to paclitaxel since oncologist suspected docetaxel caused my high temperatures and latest hospital stay. So had 1st paclitaxel yesterday and so far so good I'm a little tired but feeling good. Does anyone know if side effects kick in after a couple of days? or if I'm just OK because it's the first one? Just surprised I'm feeling so well after continuely feeling quite bad in earlier cycles. So far have have 3 EC cycles, 1 Docetaxel cycle. Then given extra week to recover after hospital stay. So yesterday's paclitaxel was the first chemo in 4 weeks.
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm in for part of May. I had 3 EC, then 1 Docetaxel and then got switched to weekly paclitaxel due to hospital stay! I've now had 4 of  the planned 6 paclitaxel. So 2 more Paclitaxel and I'll be finished chemo!  Then I'll be on to radiotherapy. I started in January and found it all quite tough up until I got switched to Paclitaxel. I'm tolerating it fairly well so far. Also have found the time has gone quite quickly. Good luck everyone!
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi all, I've had my last chemo last Thursday and so I'll be moving on to the radiotherapy thread. Start radiotherapy this Thursday. Can't quite believe chemotherapy is over. Still getting side effects of course but hope they won't stay too long. Last couple of weeks of paclitaxel brought leg pains particularly in my shins and ankles. Strangely mostly affected at night in bed. Degree of pain is not too bad but feeling exhausted since very hard to get to sleep!  Wish you all the best in your journeys with minimal side effects!
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, I found EC hard in comparison to Paclitaxel but that's just me, it seems everyones reactions to these drugs is different. I took an ear infection 1 week after my first EC and ended up in hospital with neutropenia. My white blood cell count had been severely affected by the EC so I  was unable to fight any infection. Note this was just my reaction to it ,most people do not have as severe a reaction! For the next 2 EC the oncologist reduced the dosage so that this wouldn't happen again. Apart from that my main side effects on EC were nausea, some vomiting, aches and pains, tiredness,sore mouth. I found the nausea the hardest to cope with.In my first EC it lasted for about 2 weeks then I had a good week before the next cycle. For the other 2 cycles of EC I had about 1 week of nausea followed by day by day improvement. From reading on this forum everyone reacts differently to these drugs so don't be thinking your reaction will be the same as mine.  Alot of people cope fine on EC!
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi redleaf, I found the first cycle the worst of my EC cycles. I honestly can't remember if I had a foggy brain early on in my chemo but I know I have had it but feel like I'm coming out of it now. I have just 2 paclitaxel weekly cycles to get through now. It's really hard coping with all the side effects and also not being as sharp as you normally would. Try not to expect too much of yourself, that's how I feel I coped. I told myself that this was something to get through and took each day at a time. I was in lucky position that I have been off work and could also just look after myself and rest when I needed, others are not so fortunate. Take good care of yourself and rest if you can.
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi redleaf, Sorry to hear that you are having troubles.  Not the same situation but I had just finished antibiotics just before a chemo cycle. I had them for throat infection/tonsillitis and had bad cold and they still went ahead with the chemo. I think they may base the decision on your bloods as well as how you are doing.  I know you won't want any delays but better a short delay than you becoming sicker. Hope all goes well. Take care.
Posts.Title: **MAY 2019 BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi @Haysie, So sorry you're facing this again. I too am in the same boat. See my About Me page. Actually your 1st BC seems to be very similar to my first back in 2012. I like you (are now I suspect) was in shock for a while because I just couldn't believe it was all starting again. It'll take time but you'll  get strength from somewhere and face it again. Really feel for you as you are hit by this again. Coming to this site and reading and talking with others on forums here has really helped me.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Also @Haysie just read your post again there is still a chance it's not cancer. I hope with all my heart that your consultant is wrong. Waiting for the results is such a stressful time. Take care.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Yes, if Onco recurrence score had been low would have avoided it. Unfortunately the Recurrence score was 34 so on the chemo journey this time.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Yes @Haysie, hope for your sake that if it is cancer that no chemo will be needed. If it is cancer and ER+ Her2- you should ask for Oncotype dx again or similar test to determine recurrence. I didn't get oncotype dx back in 2012, I did ask but it wasn't widely used back then and because I was very strongly ER+ 8/8 the oncologist said there was no need for the test. That particular cancer hasn't recurred in 7 yrs so I guess he was right but I still wish I had pushed for the test just to know the recurrence score  Somebody has to be that 2% (or 6% that my breast surgeon told me, both low %) getting 2 primary breast cancers. Wishing you all the best with the results. Let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, just wondering if you got your results yet, and if yes hope they were as good as possible. I'll probably be offline for a few days now due to getting g my 4th cycle of chemo tomorrow. Remember we are all rooting for you at this very stressful time .
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi @Nicecuppa, My oncologist phoned me up and told me my oncotype dx score when it came back to him. But that might have been that he was keen for me to get on with chemo since the score was high, 34. In general I found that both breast surgeon and now oncologist seemed to want to give me minimal info and I'm not sure why. I keep asking questions but definitely feel a resistance to sharing too much.
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time

Posts.Content: Hi Haysie, I'm not sure . I think the oncologists advice was probably based on everything. I think he may well have advised chemo anyway because of the weak ER+ .
Posts.Title: Cancer for a second time
